# Arpeggio: Dominant 7#5 in E (Shape: E)

## Brief Presentation
The Dominant 7#5 arpeggio in E consists of the notes E, G#, B, and D#. It is a bright-sounding arpeggio that adds tension and color to a musical piece. The raised 5th note (G#) gives it a unique flavor that can add excitement and interest to a composition.

## Notes and Intervals
- E: Root
- G#: Major 3rd
- B: Augmented 5th
- D#: Minor 7th

## Genre and Flavor
This arpeggio is commonly used in jazz, fusion, and progressive rock music. It provides a sense of tension and mystery due to the augmented 5th interval while still maintaining a dominant 7th sound. The Dominant 7#5 arpeggio can bring a sense of sophistication and complexity to a musical piece.
